entries.title: Newspaper headlines: 'You'd better watch out' and 'avoid taking risks'
entries.description: Warnings from ministers and NHS bosses ahead of Wednesday's ambulance strike cover front pages.

entries.title: Watch: Sportscene - Aberdeen v Rangers highlights
entries.description: Watch highlights of Aberdeen v Rangers in the Scottish Premiership on BBC One Scotland's Sportscene.

entries.title: The two sides of Scotland's gender law debate
entries.description: MSPs are set to decide on the controversial plans to reform gender recognition legislation.

entries.title: Ros Atkins on... China’s Covid surge
entries.description: As China deals with a new Covid wave, Ros Atkins looks at why it’s hard to assess its scale.

entries.title: Ukrainian President Zelensky to travel to US in first foreign visit since invasion - reports
entries.description: The Ukrainian leader is due to address a joint session of the US Congress, according to US media.

entries.title: Newcastle United 1-0 Bournemouth: Adam Smith own goal helps hosts reach Carabao Cup last eight
entries.description: Newcastle reach the quarter-finals of the Carabao Cup with a hard-fought win over Bournemouth at St James' Park.

entries.title: Aberdeen 2-3 Rangers: Scott Arfield's stoppage-time double salvages win for visitors
entries.description: Scott Arfield's astonishing stoppage-time double snatches Rangers a dramatic Scottish Premiership victory over Aberdeen and prevents their fragile title hopes from splintering further.

entries.title: Wolverhampton Wanderers 2-0 Gillingham: Julen Lopetegui gets off to winning start as Wolves manager
entries.description: A penalty from Raul Jimenez and a Rayan Ait-Nouri goal are enough for Wolves as they edge past League Two strugglers Gillingham in the Carabao Cup fourth round.

entries.title: Nurses' strike: 'If we have to, we'll continue to strike'
entries.description: The PM insists he won’t back down against striking workers, as nurses demand a 19% pay rise.

entries.title: Deadly California earthquake leaves thousands without power
entries.description: The magnitude 6.4 tremor struck overnight, killing at least two people and damaging roads and buildings.

entries.title: MK Dons 0-3 Leicester: Foxes ease into quarter-finals
entries.description: Leicester City reach the quarter-finals of the EFL Cup after a comfortable victory over MK Dons

entries.title: World Cup: The crowd goes wild for Argentina... in Bangladesh
entries.description: Argentina has had an army of supporters in the South Asian country since the days of Maradona.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Argentina celebrate in Buenos Aires bus parade amid jubilant scenes
entries.description: Argentina's World Cup winners are given an emotional reception by thousands of fans lining the streets of Buenos Aires.

entries.title: Ambulance strike: Health bosses warn of patient safety risk
entries.description: People are being asked to use services "wisely" and only call 999 in a life-threatening emergency.

entries.title: Kaylea Titford: Mother admits manslaughter of obese daughter
entries.description: Kaylea Louise Titford, 16, was found dead at her Powys home in October 2020.

entries.title: China Covid: Five deaths under country's new counting method
entries.description: China has been experiencing a surge in Covid cases after restrictions were eased earlier this month.

entries.title: Ghost Town: 'The song Margaret Thatcher wishes was never released'
entries.description: The Specials' most famous track became an anthem for disaffected Britain.

entries.title: Afghanistan: Taliban closes universities to women
entries.description: The move further restricts women's access to education, after they were excluded from secondary schools.

entries.title: Ivan Toney: Brentford striker charged by FA with further 30 breaches of betting rules
entries.description: Brentford striker Ivan Toney is charged by the Football Association again in relation to alleged breaches of betting rules.

entries.title: Masters 2023: LIV golfers allowed to compete at Augusta National
entries.description: Players who have signed up to the controversial LIV Golf circuit will be allowed to play at the 2023 Masters, Augusta officials confirm.

entries.title: The trip that transformed Australia and China ties, five decades on
entries.description: Australia's first ambassador to China recounts a fascinating, high-stakes visit - and his unlikely place in it.

entries.title: Who is striking? How Wednesday 21 December's walkouts will affect you
entries.description: What you need to know about Wednesday's ambulance workers strike - by the BBC’s Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Triggered lightening leaves 300 workers stuck on oil rig
entries.description: "Triggered lightning" has left staff unable to leave platforms near Denmark since November.

entries.title: Matheus Cunha: Wolves close to signing of Atletico Madrid forward
entries.description: Wolves are closing in on the loan signing of Atletico Madrid's Brazilian forward Matheus Cunha.

entries.title: Manufacturing giant to stop making 'forever chemicals'
entries.description: The firm will stop making the materials that have been linked to a range of health problems.

entries.title: Police investigate Conservative MP's Bahrain comment
entries.description: Scotland Yard says it received an online report from a man alleging he had been verbally racially abused.

entries.title: BBC correspondent mobbed by joyous Argentina fans
entries.description: The BBC's Katy Watson was surrounded by fans when reporting on World Cup celebrations in Buenos Aires.

entries.title: Shoreham air crash inquest: Victims were unlawfully killed, coroner concludes
entries.description: Eleven men died when a jet crashed on to the A27 in West Sussex during the 2015 Shoreham Airshow.

entries.title: NHS strikes: Military train to drive ambulances at London barracks
entries.description: The personnel are among 600 members of the armed forces providing assistance during strikes.

entries.title: Benin Bronzes: Germany returns looted artefacts to Nigeria
entries.description: The return of 20 Benin Bronzes is part of Germany's efforts to deal with a "dark colonial history".

entries.title: Martin Duffy: Primal Scream and Charlatans keyboardist dies at 55
entries.description: "Another tragic loss of a beautiful soul," Charlatans singer Tim Burgess says about the keyboardist.

entries.title: 'A powerful message' - how global media judged World Cup
entries.description: BBC Sport analyses how the world's media are reflecting on the conclusion of the 2022 Qatar World Cup.

entries.title: Harvey Weinstein: Former employee says NDA was 'trauma inducing'
entries.description: Rowena Chiu was silenced for 20 years by a non-disclosure agreement she signed after an alleged sexual assault.

entries.title: Lionesses: Can 2023 be even better for England's women after historic year?
entries.description: After an unforgettable year for the Lionesses, manager Sarina Wiegman reflects on their achievements and what is still to come in 2023 at the World Cup.

entries.title: Tea dunking test finds Hobnob-style does the perfect job
entries.description: Scientists answer the question of time in revealing how to avoid a soggy splash down.

entries.title: Steve Borthwick: New England coach signals new era
entries.description: New England coach Steve Borthwick flips focus from predecessor Eddie Jones as he attempts to build momentum towards next year's Rugby World Cup.

entries.title: Train drivers announce new January strike date
entries.description: The first week of the new year will be marked by rail strikes as drivers take action over pay.

entries.title: England in Pakistan: Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum restore joy to Test cricket
entries.description: You are more likely to be good at something if you enjoy it and England are winning Test matches because of the joy they bring to their cricket.

entries.title: World Cup: What to expect from tournament in 2026
entries.description: BBC Sport takes a closer look at the next World Cup which will take place in the United States, Canada and Mexico.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Zelensky visits frontline city of Bakhmut
entries.description: The Ukrainian president meets troops in a city badly damaged after months of fierce fighting.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak refusing to budge on pay as strike action escalates
entries.description: The prime minister is under pressure to reopen nurses' pay talks, as ambulance workers prepare for walk outs.

entries.title: Terry Hall: Tributes to The Specials singer who was 'one of the greats'
entries.description: The music world pays tribute to The Specials frontman and how his group soundtracked British life.

entries.title: Strike: What will ambulances respond to on Wednesday?
entries.description: What you need to know about emergency care during the ambulance strike.

entries.title: Woman, 44, charged with murdering two young boys in Dagenham
entries.description: The boys, aged two and five, were found dead at a home in east London on Friday afternoon.

entries.title: Finn Russell: Scotland fly-half to join Bath from Racing 92 next year
entries.description: British and Irish Lions fly-half Finn Russell will join Bath from Top 14 side Racing 92 after the 2023 World Cup.

entries.title: Avoid risky activity during ambulance strikes, says minister
entries.description: Will Quince says disruption should be expected during planned walkouts from paramedics on Wednesday.

entries.title: Irmgard Furchner: Nazi typist guilty of complicity in 10,500 murders
entries.description: 97-year-old Irmgard Furchner, who worked for a Nazi commandant, is convicted in Germany.

entries.title: Triumphant Argentina given heroes' welcome in Buenos Aires
entries.description: Lionel Messi's World Cup winners are greeted by thousands of fans in the early hours in Buenos Aires.

entries.title: Pakistan v England: Brendon McCullum says his team got 'close to perfect' in 3-0 win
entries.description: England coach Brendon McCullum says his team got close to perfection in their historic 3-0 clean sweep of Pakistan.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Argentina return home and bank holiday declared
entries.description: World Cup winners Argentina are greeted by jubilant fans at Buenos Aires airport and a bank holiday is declared in the country.

entries.title: Sports Personality of the Year 2022: Gadirova, Mead, Muirhead, Stokes, O'Sullivan, Wightman up for award
entries.description: A shortlist of six contenders is announced for the 2022 BBC Sports Personality of the Year award.

entries.title: TSB fined £49m over IT banking chaos
entries.description: The bank is penalised for an IT meltdown in 2018 that left customers unable to access online accounts.

entries.title: Woman 'tried to steal De Niro's gifts' from under tree
entries.description: The 79-year-old actor came downstairs in his dressing gown after he heard the commotion.

entries.title: Argentina: World Cup winners arrive in Buenos Aires after Qatar victory
entries.description: Watch the Argentina team, led by captain Lionel Messi, arrive in Buenos Aires after winning the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.

entries.title: World Cup 2022: Mbappe, Alvarez & En-Nesyri feature in 10 defining goals in Qatar
entries.description: BBC Sport relives the 10 goals that tell the story of the 2022 World Cup in Qatar, featuring Kylian Mbappe, Julian Alvarez & Youssef En-Nesyri.

entries.title: MSPs to vote on changes to gender reforms
entries.description: They are expected to sit late into the evening to consider about 150 amendments to the bill.

entries.title: Ice soldiers mark Russia's very patriotic Christmas
entries.description: A Siberian city is marking Christmas with ice statues of soldiers. But not all locals back the war.

entries.title: Pakistan v England: Tourists secure historic 3-0 sweep in Karachi
entries.description: England complete a historic 3-0 clean sweep over Pakistan inside 40 minutes on the fourth day of the final Test in Karachi.

entries.title: British Airways: Flights leaving US grounded over technical issue
entries.description: British Airways apologises to passengers left waiting in airports and on runways across the US.

entries.title: Baby's life 'probably saved' by umbilical stem cells
entries.description: An experimental treatment saves the life of baby Finley after he was born with a heart defect.

entries.title: Hugh Jackman: Wolverine star on mental health problems
entries.description: Hugh Jackman tells the BBC he struggled with anxiety and insomnia while making his new film, The Son.

entries.title: Poachers target hippos for giant teeth in place of ivory
entries.description: As bans on elephant ivory are tightened, poachers are killing hippos for their teeth, experts warn.

entries.title: Nurses to strike as ambulance crews plan walkouts
entries.description: Protests over pay continue with nurses picketing today, and paramedics set to walk out on Wednesday.

entries.title: Ethiopia civil war: The boy named ‘Wealthy’ who weighs half what he should
entries.description: Ethiopia's civil war has left tens of thousands, including large numbers of children, malnourished.

entries.title: Ukraine war: ‘We long for home - but our son has chances here’
entries.description: For some disabled refugees, fleeing Ukraine has given a better quality of life, provoking a dilemma.

entries.title: Met Office forecasts 2023 will be hotter than 2022
entries.description: The effect of a weather phenomenon causing cooler temperatures is due to end next year.

entries.title: Paul McCartney shares 'magical' Glastonbury memories and exclusive photos
entries.description: The star reflects on his historic headline set, and shares never-before-seen photos from Worthy Farm.

entries.title: Harvey Weinstein found guilty in second sex crimes trial
entries.description: The 70-year-old is already serving 23 years in jail after he was convicted in New York two years ago.

entries.title: Georgia Harrison: Revenge porn made me feel 'worthless'
entries.description: The former Love Island contestant told the BBC she wants the government to simplify laws in the UK.

entries.title: Venezuelans ignore dangers of Darién jungle
entries.description: A record number of people attempt the trek this year on foot in search of a better life in the US.

entries.title: First pictures of King Charles banknotes revealed
entries.description: Notes featuring the King's portrait will enter circulation in mid-2024, says the Bank of England.
